097/**
098 * BucketCache uses {@link BucketAllocator} to allocate/free blocks, and uses BucketCache#ramCache
099 * and BucketCache#backingMap in order to determine if a given element is in the cache. The bucket
100 * cache can use off-heap memory {@link ByteBufferIOEngine} or mmap
101 * {@link ExclusiveMemoryMmapIOEngine} or pmem {@link SharedMemoryMmapIOEngine} or local files
102 * {@link FileIOEngine} to store/read the block data.
103 * <p>
104 * Eviction is via a similar algorithm as used in
105 * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.LruBlockCache}
106 * <p>
107 * BucketCache can be used as mainly a block cache (see
108 * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.CombinedBlockCache}), combined with a BlockCache to
109 * decrease CMS GC and heap fragmentation.
110 * <p>
111 * It also can be used as a secondary cache (e.g. using a file on ssd/fusionio to store blocks) to
112 * enlarge cache space via a victim cache.
113 */
114@InterfaceAudience.Private
115public class BucketCache implements BlockCache, HeapSize {
116  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BucketCache.class);
117
118  /** Priority buckets config */
119  static final String SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.single.factor";
120  static final String MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.multi.factor";
121  static final String MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.memory.factor";
122  static final String EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.extrafreefactor";
123  static final String ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.acceptfactor";
124  static final String MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.minfactor";
125
126  /** Use strong reference for offsetLock or not */
127  private static final String STRONG_REF_KEY = "hbase.bucketcache.offsetlock.usestrongref";
128  private static final boolean STRONG_REF_DEFAULT = false;
129
130  /** Priority buckets */
131  static final float DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR = 0.25f;
132  static final float DEFAULT_MULTI_FACTOR = 0.50f;
133  static final float DEFAULT_MEMORY_FACTOR = 0.25f;
134  static final float DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR = 0.85f;
135
136  private static final float DEFAULT_EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR = 0.10f;
137  private static final float DEFAULT_ACCEPT_FACTOR = 0.95f;
138
139  // Number of blocks to clear for each of the bucket size that is full
140  private static final int DEFAULT_FREE_ENTIRE_BLOCK_FACTOR = 2;
141
142  /** Statistics thread */
143  private static final int statThreadPeriod = 5 * 60;
144
145  final static int DEFAULT_WRITER_THREADS = 3;
146  final static int DEFAULT_WRITER_QUEUE_ITEMS = 64;
147
148  // Store/read block data
149  transient final IOEngine ioEngine;
150
151  // Store the block in this map before writing it to cache
152  transient final RAMCache ramCache;
153
154  // In this map, store the block's meta data like offset, length
155  transient Map<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> backingMap;
156
157  private AtomicBoolean backingMapValidated = new AtomicBoolean(false);
158
159  /**
160   * Map of hFile -> Region -> File size. This map is used to track all files completed prefetch,
161   * together with the region those belong to and the total cached size for the
162   * region.TestBlockEvictionOnRegionMovement
163   */
164  final Map<String, Pair<String, Long>> fullyCachedFiles = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
165  /**
166   * Map of region -> total size of the region prefetched on this region server. This is the total
167   * size of hFiles for this region prefetched on this region server
168   */
169  final Map<String, Long> regionCachedSize = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
170
171  private BucketCachePersister cachePersister;
172
173  /**
174   * Flag if the cache is enabled or not... We shut it off if there are IO errors for some time, so
175   * that Bucket IO exceptions/errors don't bring down the HBase server.
176   */
177  private volatile boolean cacheEnabled;
178
179  /**
180   * A list of writer queues. We have a queue per {@link WriterThread} we have running. In other
181   * words, the work adding blocks to the BucketCache is divided up amongst the running
182   * WriterThreads. Its done by taking hash of the cache key modulo queue count. WriterThread when
183   * it runs takes whatever has been recently added and 'drains' the entries to the BucketCache. It
184   * then updates the ramCache and backingMap accordingly.
185   */
186  transient final ArrayList<BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry>> writerQueues = new ArrayList<>();
187  transient final WriterThread[] writerThreads;
188
189  /** Volatile boolean to track if free space is in process or not */
190  private volatile boolean freeInProgress = false;
191  private transient final Lock freeSpaceLock = new ReentrantLock();
192
193  private final LongAdder realCacheSize = new LongAdder();
194  private final LongAdder heapSize = new LongAdder();
195  /** Current number of cached elements */
196  private final LongAdder blockNumber = new LongAdder();
197
198  /** Cache access count (sequential ID) */
199  private final AtomicLong accessCount = new AtomicLong();
200
201  private static final int DEFAULT_CACHE_WAIT_TIME = 50;
202
203  private final BucketCacheStats cacheStats = new BucketCacheStats();
204  private final String persistencePath;
205  static AtomicBoolean isCacheInconsistent = new AtomicBoolean(false);
206  private final long cacheCapacity;
207  /** Approximate block size */
208  private final long blockSize;
209
210  /** Duration of IO errors tolerated before we disable cache, 1 min as default */
211  private final int ioErrorsTolerationDuration;
212  // 1 min
213  public static final int DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION = 60 * 1000;
214
215  // Start time of first IO error when reading or writing IO Engine, it will be
216  // reset after a successful read/write.
217  private volatile long ioErrorStartTime = -1;
218
219  private Configuration conf;
220
221  /**
222   * A ReentrantReadWriteLock to lock on a particular block identified by offset. The purpose of
223   * this is to avoid freeing the block which is being read.
224   * <p>
225   */
226  transient final IdReadWriteLock<Long> offsetLock;
227
228  NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey> blocksByHFile = new ConcurrentSkipListSet<>(
229    Comparator.comparing(BlockCacheKey::getHfileName).thenComparingLong(BlockCacheKey::getOffset));
230
231  /** Statistics thread schedule pool (for heavy debugging, could remove) */
232  private transient final ScheduledExecutorService scheduleThreadPool =
233    Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1,
234      new ThreadFactoryBuilder().setNameFormat("BucketCacheStatsExecutor").setDaemon(true).build());
235
236  // Allocate or free space for the block
237  private transient BucketAllocator bucketAllocator;
238
239  /** Acceptable size of cache (no evictions if size < acceptable) */
240  private float acceptableFactor;
241
242  /** Minimum threshold of cache (when evicting, evict until size < min) */
243  private float minFactor;
244
245  /**
246   * Free this floating point factor of extra blocks when evicting. For example free the number of
247   * blocks requested * (1 + extraFreeFactor)
248   */
249  private float extraFreeFactor;
250
251  /** Single access bucket size */
252  private float singleFactor;
253
254  /** Multiple access bucket size */
255  private float multiFactor;
256
257  /** In-memory bucket size */
258  private float memoryFactor;
259
260  private long bucketcachePersistInterval;
261
262  private static final String FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM =
263    "hbase.bucketcache.persistent.file.integrity.check.algorithm";
264  private static final String DEFAULT_FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM = "MD5";
265
266  private static final String QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME =
267    "hbase.bucketcache.queue.addition.waittime";
268  private static final long DEFAULT_QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME = 0;
269  private long queueAdditionWaitTime;
270  /**
271   * Use {@link java.security.MessageDigest} class's encryption algorithms to check persistent file
272   * integrity, default algorithm is MD5
273   */
274  private String algorithm;
275
276  /* Tracing failed Bucket Cache allocations. */
277  private long allocFailLogPrevTs; // time of previous log event for allocation failure.
278  private static final int ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD = 60000; // Default 1 minute.
279
280  public BucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
281    int writerThreadNum, int writerQLen, String persistencePath) throws IOException {
282    this(ioEngineName, capacity, blockSize, bucketSizes, writerThreadNum, writerQLen,
283      persistencePath, DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, HBaseConfiguration.create());
284  }
285
286  public BucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
287    int writerThreadNum, int writerQLen, String persistencePath, int ioErrorsTolerationDuration,
288    Configuration conf) throws IOException {
289    Preconditions.checkArgument(blockSize > 0,
290      "BucketCache capacity is set to " + blockSize + ", can not be less than 0");
291    boolean useStrongRef = conf.getBoolean(STRONG_REF_KEY, STRONG_REF_DEFAULT);
292    if (useStrongRef) {
293      this.offsetLock = new IdReadWriteLockStrongRef<>();
294    } else {
295      this.offsetLock = new IdReadWriteLockWithObjectPool<>(ReferenceType.SOFT);
296    }
297    this.conf = conf;
298    this.algorithm = conf.get(FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM, DEFAULT_FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM);
299    this.ioEngine = getIOEngineFromName(ioEngineName, capacity, persistencePath);
300    this.writerThreads = new WriterThread[writerThreadNum];
301    long blockNumCapacity = capacity / blockSize;
302    if (blockNumCapacity >= Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
303      // Enough for about 32TB of cache!
304      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cache capacity is too large, only support 32TB now");
305    }
306
307    this.acceptableFactor = conf.getFloat(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_ACCEPT_FACTOR);
308    this.minFactor = conf.getFloat(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR);
309    this.extraFreeFactor = conf.getFloat(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR);
310    this.singleFactor = conf.getFloat(SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR);
311    this.multiFactor = conf.getFloat(MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MULTI_FACTOR);
312    this.memoryFactor = conf.getFloat(MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MEMORY_FACTOR);
313    this.queueAdditionWaitTime =
314      conf.getLong(QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME, DEFAULT_QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME);
315    this.bucketcachePersistInterval = conf.getLong(BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY, 1000);
316
317    sanityCheckConfigs();
318
319    LOG.info("Instantiating BucketCache with acceptableFactor: " + acceptableFactor
320      + ", minFactor: " + minFactor + ", extraFreeFactor: " + extraFreeFactor + ", singleFactor: "
321      + singleFactor + ", multiFactor: " + multiFactor + ", memoryFactor: " + memoryFactor
322      + ", useStrongRef: " + useStrongRef);
323
324    this.cacheCapacity = capacity;
325    this.persistencePath = persistencePath;
326    this.blockSize = blockSize;
327    this.ioErrorsTolerationDuration = ioErrorsTolerationDuration;
328
329    this.allocFailLogPrevTs = 0;
330
331    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i) {
332      writerQueues.add(new ArrayBlockingQueue<>(writerQLen));
333    }
334
335    assert writerQueues.size() == writerThreads.length;
336    this.ramCache = new RAMCache();
337
338    this.backingMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>((int) blockNumCapacity);
339
340    if (isCachePersistent()) {
341      if (ioEngine instanceof FileIOEngine) {
342        startBucketCachePersisterThread();
343      }
344      try {
345        retrieveFromFile(bucketSizes);
346      } catch (IOException ioex) {
347        LOG.error("Can't restore from file[{}] because of ", persistencePath, ioex);
348        backingMap.clear();
349        fullyCachedFiles.clear();
350        backingMapValidated.set(true);
351        bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(capacity, bucketSizes);
352        regionCachedSize.clear();
353      }
354    } else {
355      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(capacity, bucketSizes);
356    }
357    final String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
358    this.cacheEnabled = true;
359    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i) {
360      writerThreads[i] = new WriterThread(writerQueues.get(i));
361      writerThreads[i].setName(threadName + "-BucketCacheWriter-" + i);
362      writerThreads[i].setDaemon(true);
363    }
364    startWriterThreads();
365
366    // Run the statistics thread periodically to print the cache statistics log
367    // TODO: Add means of turning this off. Bit obnoxious running thread just to make a log
368    // every five minutes.
369    this.scheduleThreadPool.scheduleAtFixedRate(new StatisticsThread(this), statThreadPeriod,
370      statThreadPeriod, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
371    LOG.info("Started bucket cache; ioengine=" + ioEngineName + ", capacity="
372      + StringUtils.byteDesc(capacity) + ", blockSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(blockSize)
373      + ", writerThreadNum=" + writerThreadNum + ", writerQLen=" + writerQLen + ", persistencePath="
374      + persistencePath + ", bucketAllocator=" + this.bucketAllocator.getClass().getName());
375  }
376
377  private void sanityCheckConfigs() {
378    Preconditions.checkArgument(acceptableFactor <= 1 && acceptableFactor >= 0,
379      ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
380    Preconditions.checkArgument(minFactor <= 1 && minFactor >= 0,
381      MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
382    Preconditions.checkArgument(minFactor <= acceptableFactor,
383      MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be <= " + ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME);
384    Preconditions.checkArgument(extraFreeFactor >= 0,
385      EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be greater than 0.0");
386    Preconditions.checkArgument(singleFactor <= 1 && singleFactor >= 0,
387      SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
388    Preconditions.checkArgument(multiFactor <= 1 && multiFactor >= 0,
389      MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
390    Preconditions.checkArgument(memoryFactor <= 1 && memoryFactor >= 0,
391      MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
392    Preconditions.checkArgument((singleFactor + multiFactor + memoryFactor) == 1,
393      SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + ", " + MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + ", and "
394        + MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " segments must add up to 1.0");
395  }
396
397  /**
398   * Called by the constructor to start the writer threads. Used by tests that need to override
399   * starting the threads.
400   */
401  protected void startWriterThreads() {
402    for (WriterThread thread : writerThreads) {
403      thread.start();
404    }
405  }
406
407  void startBucketCachePersisterThread() {
408    LOG.info("Starting BucketCachePersisterThread");
409    cachePersister = new BucketCachePersister(this, bucketcachePersistInterval);
410    cachePersister.setDaemon(true);
411    cachePersister.start();
412  }
413
414  boolean isCacheEnabled() {
415    return this.cacheEnabled;
416  }
417
418  @Override
419  public long getMaxSize() {
420    return this.cacheCapacity;
421  }
422
423  public String getIoEngine() {
424    return ioEngine.toString();
425  }
426
427  /**
428   * Get the IOEngine from the IO engine name
429   * @return the IOEngine
430   */
431  private IOEngine getIOEngineFromName(String ioEngineName, long capacity, String persistencePath)
432    throws IOException {
433    if (ioEngineName.startsWith("file:") || ioEngineName.startsWith("files:")) {
434      // In order to make the usage simple, we only need the prefix 'files:' in
435      // document whether one or multiple file(s), but also support 'file:' for
436      // the compatibility
437      String[] filePaths =
438        ioEngineName.substring(ioEngineName.indexOf(":") + 1).split(FileIOEngine.FILE_DELIMITER);
439      return new FileIOEngine(capacity, persistencePath != null, filePaths);
440    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("offheap")) {
441      return new ByteBufferIOEngine(capacity);
442    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("mmap:")) {
443      return new ExclusiveMemoryMmapIOEngine(ioEngineName.substring(5), capacity);
444    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("pmem:")) {
445      // This mode of bucket cache creates an IOEngine over a file on the persistent memory
446      // device. Since the persistent memory device has its own address space the contents
447      // mapped to this address space does not get swapped out like in the case of mmapping
448      // on to DRAM. Hence the cells created out of the hfile blocks in the pmem bucket cache
449      // can be directly referred to without having to copy them onheap. Once the RPC is done,
450      // the blocks can be returned back as in case of ByteBufferIOEngine.
451      return new SharedMemoryMmapIOEngine(ioEngineName.substring(5), capacity);
452    } else {
453      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
454        "Don't understand io engine name for cache- prefix with file:, files:, mmap: or offheap");
455    }
456  }
457
458  public boolean isCachePersistenceEnabled() {
459    return persistencePath != null;
460  }
461
462  /**
463   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
464   * @param cacheKey block's cache key
465   * @param buf      block buffer
466   */
467  @Override
468  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable buf) {
469    cacheBlock(cacheKey, buf, false);
470  }
471
472  /**
473   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
474   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
475   * @param cachedItem block buffer
476   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
477   */
478  @Override
479  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory) {
480    cacheBlockWithWait(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, false);
481  }
482
483  /**
484   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
485   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
486   * @param cachedItem block buffer
487   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
488   */
489  @Override
490  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory,
491    boolean waitWhenCache) {
492    cacheBlockWithWait(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, waitWhenCache && queueAdditionWaitTime > 0);
493  }
494
495  /**
496   * Cache the block to ramCache
497   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
498   * @param cachedItem block buffer
499   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
500   * @param wait       if true, blocking wait when queue is full
501   */
502  public void cacheBlockWithWait(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory,
503    boolean wait) {
504    if (cacheEnabled) {
505      if (backingMap.containsKey(cacheKey) || ramCache.containsKey(cacheKey)) {
506        if (shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(cacheKey, cachedItem)) {
507          BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
508          if (bucketEntry != null && bucketEntry.isRpcRef()) {
509            // avoid replace when there are RPC refs for the bucket entry in bucket cache
510            return;
511          }
512          cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, wait);
513        }
514      } else {
515        cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, wait);
516      }
517    }
518  }
519
520  protected boolean shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable newBlock) {
521    return BlockCacheUtil.shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(this, cacheKey, newBlock);
522  }
523
524  protected void cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem,
525    boolean inMemory, boolean wait) {
526    if (!cacheEnabled) {
527      return;
528    }
529    if (cacheKey.getBlockType() == null && cachedItem.getBlockType() != null) {
530      cacheKey.setBlockType(cachedItem.getBlockType());
531    }
532    LOG.trace("Caching key={}, item={}", cacheKey, cachedItem);
533    // Stuff the entry into the RAM cache so it can get drained to the persistent store
534    RAMQueueEntry re = new RAMQueueEntry(cacheKey, cachedItem, accessCount.incrementAndGet(),
535      inMemory, isCachePersistent() && ioEngine instanceof FileIOEngine);
536    /**
537     * Don't use ramCache.put(cacheKey, re) here. because there may be a existing entry with same
538     * key in ramCache, the heap size of bucket cache need to update if replacing entry from
539     * ramCache. But WriterThread will also remove entry from ramCache and update heap size, if
540     * using ramCache.put(), It's possible that the removed entry in WriterThread is not the correct
541     * one, then the heap size will mess up (HBASE-20789)
542     */
543    if (ramCache.putIfAbsent(cacheKey, re) != null) {
544      return;
545    }
546    int queueNum = (cacheKey.hashCode() & 0x7FFFFFFF) % writerQueues.size();
547    BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> bq = writerQueues.get(queueNum);
548    boolean successfulAddition = false;
549    if (wait) {
550      try {
551        successfulAddition = bq.offer(re, queueAdditionWaitTime, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
552      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
553        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
554      }
555    } else {
556      successfulAddition = bq.offer(re);
557    }
558    if (!successfulAddition) {
559      ramCache.remove(cacheKey);
560      cacheStats.failInsert();
561    } else {
562      this.blockNumber.increment();
563      this.heapSize.add(cachedItem.heapSize());
564    }
565  }
566
567  /**
568   * If the passed cache key relates to a reference (&lt;hfile&gt;.&lt;parentEncRegion&gt;), this
569   * method looks for the block from the referred file, in the cache. If present in the cache, the
570   * block for the referred file is returned, otherwise, this method returns null. It will also
571   * return null if the passed cache key doesn't relate to a reference.
572   * @param key the BlockCacheKey instance to look for in the cache.
573   * @return the cached block from the referred file, null if there's no such block in the cache or
574   *         the passed key doesn't relate to a reference.
575   */
576  public BucketEntry getBlockForReference(BlockCacheKey key) {
577    BucketEntry foundEntry = null;
578    String referredFileName = null;
579    if (StoreFileInfo.isReference(key.getHfileName())) {
580      referredFileName = StoreFileInfo.getReferredToRegionAndFile(key.getHfileName()).getSecond();
581    }
582    if (referredFileName != null) {
583      BlockCacheKey convertedCacheKey = new BlockCacheKey(referredFileName, key.getOffset());
584      foundEntry = backingMap.get(convertedCacheKey);
585      LOG.debug("Got a link/ref: {}. Related cacheKey: {}. Found entry: {}", key.getHfileName(),
586        convertedCacheKey, foundEntry);
587    }
588    return foundEntry;
589  }
590
591  /**
592   * Get the buffer of the block with the specified key.
593   * @param key                block's cache key
594   * @param caching            true if the caller caches blocks on cache misses
595   * @param repeat             Whether this is a repeat lookup for the same block
596   * @param updateCacheMetrics Whether we should update cache metrics or not
597   * @return buffer of specified cache key, or null if not in cache
598   */
599  @Override
600  public Cacheable getBlock(BlockCacheKey key, boolean caching, boolean repeat,
601    boolean updateCacheMetrics) {
602    if (!cacheEnabled) {
603      return null;
604    }
605    RAMQueueEntry re = ramCache.get(key);
606    if (re != null) {
607      if (updateCacheMetrics) {
608        cacheStats.hit(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
609      }
610      re.access(accessCount.incrementAndGet());
611      return re.getData();
612    }
613    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(key);
614    if (bucketEntry == null) {
615      bucketEntry = getBlockForReference(key);
616    }
617    if (bucketEntry != null) {
618      long start = System.nanoTime();
619      ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = offsetLock.getLock(bucketEntry.offset());
620      try {
621        lock.readLock().lock();
622        // We can not read here even if backingMap does contain the given key because its offset
623        // maybe changed. If we lock BlockCacheKey instead of offset, then we can only check
624        // existence here.
625        if (
626          bucketEntry.equals(backingMap.get(key)) || bucketEntry.equals(getBlockForReference(key))
627        ) {
628          // Read the block from IOEngine based on the bucketEntry's offset and length, NOTICE: the
629          // block will use the refCnt of bucketEntry, which means if two HFileBlock mapping to
630          // the same BucketEntry, then all of the three will share the same refCnt.
631          Cacheable cachedBlock = ioEngine.read(bucketEntry);
632          if (ioEngine.usesSharedMemory()) {
633            // If IOEngine use shared memory, cachedBlock and BucketEntry will share the
634            // same RefCnt, do retain here, in order to count the number of RPC references
635            cachedBlock.retain();
636          }
637          // Update the cache statistics.
638          if (updateCacheMetrics) {
639            cacheStats.hit(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
640            cacheStats.ioHit(System.nanoTime() - start);
641          }
642          bucketEntry.access(accessCount.incrementAndGet());
643          if (this.ioErrorStartTime > 0) {
644            ioErrorStartTime = -1;
645          }
646          return cachedBlock;
647        }
648      } catch (HBaseIOException hioex) {
649        // When using file io engine persistent cache,
650        // the cache map state might differ from the actual cache. If we reach this block,
651        // we should remove the cache key entry from the backing map
652        backingMap.remove(key);
653        fullyCachedFiles.remove(key.getHfileName());
654        LOG.debug("Failed to fetch block for cache key: {}.", key, hioex);
655      } catch (IOException ioex) {
656        LOG.error("Failed reading block " + key + " from bucket cache", ioex);
657        checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
658      } finally {
659        lock.readLock().unlock();
660      }
661    }
662    if (!repeat && updateCacheMetrics) {
663      cacheStats.miss(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
664    }
665    return null;
666  }
667
668  /**
669   * This method is invoked after the bucketEntry is removed from {@link BucketCache#backingMap}
670   */
671  void blockEvicted(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry, boolean decrementBlockNumber,
672    boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {
673    bucketEntry.markAsEvicted();
674    blocksByHFile.remove(cacheKey);
675    if (decrementBlockNumber) {
676      this.blockNumber.decrement();
677      if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
678        fileNotFullyCached(cacheKey.getHfileName());
679      }
680    }
681    if (evictedByEvictionProcess) {
682      cacheStats.evicted(bucketEntry.getCachedTime(), cacheKey.isPrimary());
683    }
684    if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
685      setCacheInconsistent(true);
686    }
687  }
688
689  private void fileNotFullyCached(String hfileName) {
690    // Update the regionPrefetchedSizeMap before removing the file from prefetchCompleted
691    if (fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(hfileName)) {
692      Pair<String, Long> regionEntry = fullyCachedFiles.get(hfileName);
693      String regionEncodedName = regionEntry.getFirst();
694      long filePrefetchSize = regionEntry.getSecond();
695      LOG.debug("Removing file {} for region {}", hfileName, regionEncodedName);
696      regionCachedSize.computeIfPresent(regionEncodedName, (rn, pf) -> pf - filePrefetchSize);
697      // If all the blocks for a region are evicted from the cache, remove the entry for that region
698      if (
699        regionCachedSize.containsKey(regionEncodedName)
700          && regionCachedSize.get(regionEncodedName) == 0
701      ) {
702        regionCachedSize.remove(regionEncodedName);
703      }
704    }
705    fullyCachedFiles.remove(hfileName);
706  }
707
708  public void fileCacheCompleted(Path filePath, long size) {
709    Pair<String, Long> pair = new Pair<>();
710    // sets the region name
711    String regionName = filePath.getParent().getParent().getName();
712    pair.setFirst(regionName);
713    pair.setSecond(size);
714    fullyCachedFiles.put(filePath.getName(), pair);
715  }
716
717  private void updateRegionCachedSize(Path filePath, long cachedSize) {
718    if (filePath != null) {
719      String regionName = filePath.getParent().getParent().getName();
720      regionCachedSize.merge(regionName, cachedSize,
721        (previousSize, newBlockSize) -> previousSize + newBlockSize);
722    }
723  }
724
725  /**
726   * Free the {{@link BucketEntry} actually,which could only be invoked when the
727   * {@link BucketEntry#refCnt} becoming 0.
728   */
729  void freeBucketEntry(BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
730    bucketAllocator.freeBlock(bucketEntry.offset(), bucketEntry.getLength());
731    realCacheSize.add(-1 * bucketEntry.getLength());
732  }
733
734  /**
735   * Try to evict the block from {@link BlockCache} by force. We'll call this in few cases:<br>
736   * 1. Close an HFile, and clear all cached blocks. <br>
737   * 2. Call {@link Admin#clearBlockCache(TableName)} to clear all blocks for a given table.<br>
738   * <p>
739   * Firstly, we'll try to remove the block from RAMCache,and then try to evict from backingMap.
740   * Here we evict the block from backingMap immediately, but only free the reference from bucket
741   * cache by calling {@link BucketEntry#markedAsEvicted}. If there're still some RPC referring this
742   * block, block can only be de-allocated when all of them release the block.
743   * <p>
744   * NOTICE: we need to grab the write offset lock firstly before releasing the reference from
745   * bucket cache. if we don't, we may read an {@link BucketEntry} with refCnt = 0 when
746   * {@link BucketCache#getBlock(BlockCacheKey, boolean, boolean, boolean)}, it's a memory leak.
747   * @param cacheKey Block to evict
748   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
749   */
750  @Override
751  public boolean evictBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
752    return doEvictBlock(cacheKey, null, false);
753  }
754
755  /**
756   * Evict the {@link BlockCacheKey} and {@link BucketEntry} from {@link BucketCache#backingMap} and
757   * {@link BucketCache#ramCache}. <br/>
758   * NOTE:When Evict from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},only the matched {@link BlockCacheKey} and
759   * {@link BucketEntry} could be removed.
760   * @param cacheKey    {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
761   * @param bucketEntry {@link BucketEntry} matched {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
762   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
763   */
764  private boolean doEvictBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry,
765    boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {
766    if (!cacheEnabled) {
767      return false;
768    }
769    boolean existedInRamCache = removeFromRamCache(cacheKey);
770    if (bucketEntry == null) {
771      bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
772    }
773    final BucketEntry bucketEntryToUse = bucketEntry;
774
775    if (bucketEntryToUse == null) {
776      if (existedInRamCache && evictedByEvictionProcess) {
777        cacheStats.evicted(0, cacheKey.isPrimary());
778      }
779      return existedInRamCache;
780    } else {
781      return bucketEntryToUse.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
782        if (backingMap.remove(cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse)) {
783          LOG.debug("removed key {} from back map with offset lock {} in the evict process",
784            cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse.offset());
785          blockEvicted(cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse, !existedInRamCache, evictedByEvictionProcess);
786          return true;
787        }
788        return false;
789      });
790    }
791  }
792
793  /**
794   * <pre>
795   * Create the {@link Recycler} for {@link BucketEntry#refCnt},which would be used as
796   * {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} returned from {@link BucketCache#getBlock}.
797   * NOTE: for {@link BucketCache#getBlock},the {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf}
798   * from {@link BucketCache#backingMap} and {@link BucketCache#ramCache} are different:
799   * 1.For {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},
800   *   it is the return value of current {@link BucketCache#createRecycler} method.
801   *
802   * 2.For {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} from {@link BucketCache#ramCache},
803   *   it is {@link ByteBuffAllocator#putbackBuffer}.
804   * </pre>
805   */
806  private Recycler createRecycler(final BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
807    return () -> {
808      freeBucketEntry(bucketEntry);
809      return;
810    };
811  }
812
813  /**
814   * NOTE: This method is only for test.
815   */
816  public boolean evictBlockIfNoRpcReferenced(BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey) {
817    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(blockCacheKey);
818    if (bucketEntry == null) {
819      return false;
820    }
821    return evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(blockCacheKey, bucketEntry);
822  }
823
824  /**
825   * Evict {@link BlockCacheKey} and its corresponding {@link BucketEntry} only if
826   * {@link BucketEntry#isRpcRef} is false. <br/>
827   * NOTE:When evict from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},only the matched {@link BlockCacheKey} and
828   * {@link BucketEntry} could be removed.
829   * @param blockCacheKey {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
830   * @param bucketEntry   {@link BucketEntry} matched {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
831   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
832   */
833  boolean evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
834    if (!bucketEntry.isRpcRef()) {
835      return doEvictBlock(blockCacheKey, bucketEntry, true);
836    }
837    return false;
838  }
839
840  protected boolean removeFromRamCache(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
841    return ramCache.remove(cacheKey, re -> {
842      if (re != null) {
843        this.blockNumber.decrement();
844        this.heapSize.add(-1 * re.getData().heapSize());
845      }
846    });
847  }
848
849  public boolean isCacheInconsistent() {
850    return isCacheInconsistent.get();
851  }
852
853  public void setCacheInconsistent(boolean setCacheInconsistent) {
854    isCacheInconsistent.set(setCacheInconsistent);
855  }
856
857  /*
858   * Statistics thread. Periodically output cache statistics to the log.
859   */
860  private static class StatisticsThread extends Thread {
861    private final BucketCache bucketCache;
862
863    public StatisticsThread(BucketCache bucketCache) {
864      super("BucketCacheStatsThread");
865      setDaemon(true);
866      this.bucketCache = bucketCache;
867    }
868
869    @Override
870    public void run() {
871      bucketCache.logStats();
872    }
873  }
874
875  public void logStats() {
876    long totalSize = bucketAllocator.getTotalSize();
877    long usedSize = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
878    long freeSize = totalSize - usedSize;
879    long cacheSize = getRealCacheSize();
880    LOG.info("failedBlockAdditions=" + cacheStats.getFailedInserts() + ", " + "totalSize="
881      + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize) + ", " + "freeSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(freeSize) + ", "
882      + "usedSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(usedSize) + ", " + "cacheSize="
883      + StringUtils.byteDesc(cacheSize) + ", " + "accesses=" + cacheStats.getRequestCount() + ", "
884      + "hits=" + cacheStats.getHitCount() + ", " + "IOhitsPerSecond="
885      + cacheStats.getIOHitsPerSecond() + ", " + "IOTimePerHit="
886      + String.format("%.2f", cacheStats.getIOTimePerHit()) + ", " + "hitRatio="
887      + (cacheStats.getHitCount() == 0
888        ? "0,"
889        : (StringUtils.formatPercent(cacheStats.getHitRatio(), 2) + ", "))
890      + "cachingAccesses=" + cacheStats.getRequestCachingCount() + ", " + "cachingHits="
891      + cacheStats.getHitCachingCount() + ", " + "cachingHitsRatio="
892      + (cacheStats.getHitCachingCount() == 0
893        ? "0,"
894        : (StringUtils.formatPercent(cacheStats.getHitCachingRatio(), 2) + ", "))
895      + "evictions=" + cacheStats.getEvictionCount() + ", " + "evicted="
896      + cacheStats.getEvictedCount() + ", " + "evictedPerRun=" + cacheStats.evictedPerEviction()
897      + ", " + "allocationFailCount=" + cacheStats.getAllocationFailCount());
898    cacheStats.reset();
899
900    bucketAllocator.logDebugStatistics();
901  }
902
903  public long getRealCacheSize() {
904    return this.realCacheSize.sum();
905  }
906
907  public long acceptableSize() {
908    return (long) Math.floor(bucketAllocator.getTotalSize() * acceptableFactor);
909  }
910
911  long getPartitionSize(float partitionFactor) {
912    return (long) Math.floor(bucketAllocator.getTotalSize() * partitionFactor * minFactor);
913  }
914
915  /**
916   * Return the count of bucketSizeinfos still need free space
917   */
918  private int bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(float minFactor) {
919    BucketAllocator.IndexStatistics[] stats = bucketAllocator.getIndexStatistics();
920    int fullCount = 0;
921    for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
922      long freeGoal = (long) Math.floor(stats[i].totalCount() * (1 - minFactor));
923      freeGoal = Math.max(freeGoal, 1);
924      if (stats[i].freeCount() < freeGoal) {
925        fullCount++;
926      }
927    }
928    return fullCount;
929  }
930
931  /**
932   * This method will find the buckets that are minimally occupied and are not reference counted and
933   * will free them completely without any constraint on the access times of the elements, and as a
934   * process will completely free at most the number of buckets passed, sometimes it might not due
935   * to changing refCounts
936   * @param completelyFreeBucketsNeeded number of buckets to free
937   **/
938  private void freeEntireBuckets(int completelyFreeBucketsNeeded) {
939    if (completelyFreeBucketsNeeded != 0) {
940      // First we will build a set where the offsets are reference counted, usually
941      // this set is small around O(Handler Count) unless something else is wrong
942      Set<Integer> inUseBuckets = new HashSet<>();
943      backingMap.forEach((k, be) -> {
944        if (be.isRpcRef()) {
945          inUseBuckets.add(bucketAllocator.getBucketIndex(be.offset()));
946        }
947      });
948      Set<Integer> candidateBuckets =
949        bucketAllocator.getLeastFilledBuckets(inUseBuckets, completelyFreeBucketsNeeded);
950      for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> entry : backingMap.entrySet()) {
951        if (candidateBuckets.contains(bucketAllocator.getBucketIndex(entry.getValue().offset()))) {
952          evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
953        }
954      }
955    }
956  }
957
958  /**
959   * Free the space if the used size reaches acceptableSize() or one size block couldn't be
960   * allocated. When freeing the space, we use the LRU algorithm and ensure there must be some
961   * blocks evicted
962   * @param why Why we are being called
963   */
964  void freeSpace(final String why) {
965    // Ensure only one freeSpace progress at a time
966    if (!freeSpaceLock.tryLock()) {
967      return;
968    }
969    try {
970      freeInProgress = true;
971      long bytesToFreeWithoutExtra = 0;
972      // Calculate free byte for each bucketSizeinfo
973      StringBuilder msgBuffer = LOG.isDebugEnabled() ? new StringBuilder() : null;
974      BucketAllocator.IndexStatistics[] stats = bucketAllocator.getIndexStatistics();
975      long[] bytesToFreeForBucket = new long[stats.length];
976      for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
977        bytesToFreeForBucket[i] = 0;
978        long freeGoal = (long) Math.floor(stats[i].totalCount() * (1 - minFactor));
979        freeGoal = Math.max(freeGoal, 1);
980        if (stats[i].freeCount() < freeGoal) {
981          bytesToFreeForBucket[i] = stats[i].itemSize() * (freeGoal - stats[i].freeCount());
982          bytesToFreeWithoutExtra += bytesToFreeForBucket[i];
983          if (msgBuffer != null) {
984            msgBuffer.append("Free for bucketSize(" + stats[i].itemSize() + ")="
985              + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesToFreeForBucket[i]) + ", ");
986          }
987        }
988      }
989      if (msgBuffer != null) {
990        msgBuffer.append("Free for total=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesToFreeWithoutExtra) + ", ");
991      }
992
993      if (bytesToFreeWithoutExtra <= 0) {
994        return;
995      }
996      long currentSize = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
997      long totalSize = bucketAllocator.getTotalSize();
998      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled() && msgBuffer != null) {
999        LOG.debug("Free started because \"" + why + "\"; " + msgBuffer.toString()
1000          + " of current used=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(currentSize) + ", actual cacheSize="
1001          + StringUtils.byteDesc(realCacheSize.sum()) + ", total="
1002          + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize));
1003      }
1004
1005      long bytesToFreeWithExtra =
1006        (long) Math.floor(bytesToFreeWithoutExtra * (1 + extraFreeFactor));
1007
1008      // Instantiate priority buckets
1009      BucketEntryGroup bucketSingle =
1010        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(singleFactor));
1011      BucketEntryGroup bucketMulti =
1012        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(multiFactor));
1013      BucketEntryGroup bucketMemory =
1014        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(memoryFactor));
1015
1016      // Scan entire map putting bucket entry into appropriate bucket entry
1017      // group
1018      for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> bucketEntryWithKey : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1019        switch (bucketEntryWithKey.getValue().getPriority()) {
1020          case SINGLE: {
1021            bucketSingle.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1022            break;
1023          }
1024          case MULTI: {
1025            bucketMulti.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1026            break;
1027          }
1028          case MEMORY: {
1029            bucketMemory.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1030            break;
1031          }
1032        }
1033      }
1034
1035      PriorityQueue<BucketEntryGroup> bucketQueue =
1036        new PriorityQueue<>(3, Comparator.comparingLong(BucketEntryGroup::overflow));
1037
1038      bucketQueue.add(bucketSingle);
1039      bucketQueue.add(bucketMulti);
1040      bucketQueue.add(bucketMemory);
1041
1042      int remainingBuckets = bucketQueue.size();
1043      long bytesFreed = 0;
1044
1045      BucketEntryGroup bucketGroup;
1046      while ((bucketGroup = bucketQueue.poll()) != null) {
1047        long overflow = bucketGroup.overflow();
1048        if (overflow > 0) {
1049          long bucketBytesToFree =
1050            Math.min(overflow, (bytesToFreeWithoutExtra - bytesFreed) / remainingBuckets);
1051          bytesFreed += bucketGroup.free(bucketBytesToFree);
1052        }
1053        remainingBuckets--;
1054      }
1055
1056      // Check and free if there are buckets that still need freeing of space
1057      if (bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(minFactor) > 0) {
1058        bucketQueue.clear();
1059        remainingBuckets = 3;
1060
1061        bucketQueue.add(bucketSingle);
1062        bucketQueue.add(bucketMulti);
1063        bucketQueue.add(bucketMemory);
1064
1065        while ((bucketGroup = bucketQueue.poll()) != null) {
1066          long bucketBytesToFree = (bytesToFreeWithExtra - bytesFreed) / remainingBuckets;
1067          bytesFreed += bucketGroup.free(bucketBytesToFree);
1068          remainingBuckets--;
1069        }
1070      }
1071
1072      // Even after the above free we might still need freeing because of the
1073      // De-fragmentation of the buckets (also called Slab Calcification problem), i.e
1074      // there might be some buckets where the occupancy is very sparse and thus are not
1075      // yielding the free for the other bucket sizes, the fix for this to evict some
1076      // of the buckets, we do this by evicting the buckets that are least fulled
1077      freeEntireBuckets(DEFAULT_FREE_ENTIRE_BLOCK_FACTOR * bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(1.0f));
1078
1079      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1080        long single = bucketSingle.totalSize();
1081        long multi = bucketMulti.totalSize();
1082        long memory = bucketMemory.totalSize();
1083        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1084          LOG.debug("Bucket cache free space completed; " + "freed="
1085            + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesFreed) + ", " + "total=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize)
1086            + ", " + "single=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(single) + ", " + "multi="
1087            + StringUtils.byteDesc(multi) + ", " + "memory=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(memory));
1088        }
1089      }
1090
1091    } catch (Throwable t) {
1092      LOG.warn("Failed freeing space", t);
1093    } finally {
1094      cacheStats.evict();
1095      freeInProgress = false;
1096      freeSpaceLock.unlock();
1097    }
1098  }
1099
1100  // This handles flushing the RAM cache to IOEngine.
1101  class WriterThread extends Thread {
1102    private final BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> inputQueue;
1103    private volatile boolean writerEnabled = true;
1104    private final ByteBuffer metaBuff = ByteBuffer.allocate(HFileBlock.BLOCK_METADATA_SPACE);
1105
1106    WriterThread(BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> queue) {
1107      super("BucketCacheWriterThread");
1108      this.inputQueue = queue;
1109    }
1110
1111    // Used for test
1112    void disableWriter() {
1113      this.writerEnabled = false;
1114    }
1115
1116    @Override
1117    public void run() {
1118      List<RAMQueueEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();
1119      try {
1120        while (cacheEnabled && writerEnabled) {
1121          try {
1122            try {
1123              // Blocks
1124              entries = getRAMQueueEntries(inputQueue, entries);
1125            } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1126              if (!cacheEnabled || !writerEnabled) {
1127                break;
1128              }
1129            }
1130            doDrain(entries, metaBuff);
1131          } catch (Exception ioe) {
1132            LOG.error("WriterThread encountered error", ioe);
1133          }
1134        }
1135      } catch (Throwable t) {
1136        LOG.warn("Failed doing drain", t);
1137      }
1138      LOG.info(this.getName() + " exiting, cacheEnabled=" + cacheEnabled);
1139    }
1140  }
1141
1142  /**
1143   * Put the new bucket entry into backingMap. Notice that we are allowed to replace the existing
1144   * cache with a new block for the same cache key. there's a corner case: one thread cache a block
1145   * in ramCache, copy to io-engine and add a bucket entry to backingMap. Caching another new block
1146   * with the same cache key do the same thing for the same cache key, so if not evict the previous
1147   * bucket entry, then memory leak happen because the previous bucketEntry is gone but the
1148   * bucketAllocator do not free its memory.
1149   * @see BlockCacheUtil#shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(BlockCache blockCache,BlockCacheKey
1150   *      cacheKey, Cacheable newBlock)
1151   * @param key         Block cache key
1152   * @param bucketEntry Bucket entry to put into backingMap.
1153   */
1154  protected void putIntoBackingMap(BlockCacheKey key, BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
1155    BucketEntry previousEntry = backingMap.put(key, bucketEntry);
1156    blocksByHFile.add(key);
1157    updateRegionCachedSize(key.getFilePath(), bucketEntry.getLength());
1158    if (previousEntry != null && previousEntry != bucketEntry) {
1159      previousEntry.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
1160        blockEvicted(key, previousEntry, false, false);
1161        return null;
1162      });
1163    }
1164  }
1165
1166  /**
1167   * Prepare and return a warning message for Bucket Allocator Exception
1168   * @param fle The exception
1169   * @param re  The RAMQueueEntry for which the exception was thrown.
1170   * @return A warning message created from the input RAMQueueEntry object.
1171   */
1172  private static String getAllocationFailWarningMessage(final BucketAllocatorException fle,
1173    final RAMQueueEntry re) {
1174    final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1175    sb.append("Most recent failed allocation after ");
1176    sb.append(ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD);
1177    sb.append(" ms;");
1178    if (re != null) {
1179      if (re.getData() instanceof HFileBlock) {
1180        final HFileContext fileContext = ((HFileBlock) re.getData()).getHFileContext();
1181        final String columnFamily = Bytes.toString(fileContext.getColumnFamily());
1182        final String tableName = Bytes.toString(fileContext.getTableName());
1183        if (tableName != null) {
1184          sb.append(" Table: ");
1185          sb.append(tableName);
1186        }
1187        if (columnFamily != null) {
1188          sb.append(" CF: ");
1189          sb.append(columnFamily);
1190        }
1191        sb.append(" HFile: ");
1192        if (fileContext.getHFileName() != null) {
1193          sb.append(fileContext.getHFileName());
1194        } else {
1195          sb.append(re.getKey());
1196        }
1197      } else {
1198        sb.append(" HFile: ");
1199        sb.append(re.getKey());
1200      }
1201    }
1202    sb.append(" Message: ");
1203    sb.append(fle.getMessage());
1204    return sb.toString();
1205  }
1206
1207  /**
1208   * Flush the entries in ramCache to IOEngine and add bucket entry to backingMap. Process all that
1209   * are passed in even if failure being sure to remove from ramCache else we'll never undo the
1210   * references and we'll OOME.
1211   * @param entries Presumes list passed in here will be processed by this invocation only. No
1212   *                interference expected.
1213   */
1214  void doDrain(final List<RAMQueueEntry> entries, ByteBuffer metaBuff) throws InterruptedException {
1215    if (entries.isEmpty()) {
1216      return;
1217    }
1218    // This method is a little hard to follow. We run through the passed in entries and for each
1219    // successful add, we add a non-null BucketEntry to the below bucketEntries. Later we must
1220    // do cleanup making sure we've cleared ramCache of all entries regardless of whether we
1221    // successfully added the item to the bucketcache; if we don't do the cleanup, we'll OOME by
1222    // filling ramCache. We do the clean up by again running through the passed in entries
1223    // doing extra work when we find a non-null bucketEntries corresponding entry.
1224    final int size = entries.size();
1225    BucketEntry[] bucketEntries = new BucketEntry[size];
1226    // Index updated inside loop if success or if we can't succeed. We retry if cache is full
1227    // when we go to add an entry by going around the loop again without upping the index.
1228    int index = 0;
1229    while (cacheEnabled && index < size) {
1230      RAMQueueEntry re = null;
1231      try {
1232        re = entries.get(index);
1233        if (re == null) {
1234          LOG.warn("Couldn't get entry or changed on us; who else is messing with it?");
1235          index++;
1236          continue;
1237        }
1238        // Reset the position for reuse.
1239        // It should be guaranteed that the data in the metaBuff has been transferred to the
1240        // ioEngine safely. Otherwise, this reuse is problematic. Fortunately, the data is already
1241        // transferred with our current IOEngines. Should take care, when we have new kinds of
1242        // IOEngine in the future.
1243        metaBuff.clear();
1244        BucketEntry bucketEntry =
1245          re.writeToCache(ioEngine, bucketAllocator, realCacheSize, this::createRecycler, metaBuff);
1246        // Successfully added. Up index and add bucketEntry. Clear io exceptions.
1247        bucketEntries[index] = bucketEntry;
1248        if (ioErrorStartTime > 0) {
1249          ioErrorStartTime = -1;
1250        }
1251        index++;
1252      } catch (BucketAllocatorException fle) {
1253        long currTs = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1254        cacheStats.allocationFailed(); // Record the warning.
1255        if (
1256          allocFailLogPrevTs == 0 || (currTs - allocFailLogPrevTs) > ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD
1257        ) {
1258          LOG.warn(getAllocationFailWarningMessage(fle, re));
1259          allocFailLogPrevTs = currTs;
1260        }
1261        // Presume can't add. Too big? Move index on. Entry will be cleared from ramCache below.
1262        bucketEntries[index] = null;
1263        index++;
1264      } catch (CacheFullException cfe) {
1265        // Cache full when we tried to add. Try freeing space and then retrying (don't up index)
1266        if (!freeInProgress) {
1267          freeSpace("Full!");
1268        } else {
1269          Thread.sleep(50);
1270        }
1271      } catch (IOException ioex) {
1272        // Hopefully transient. Retry. checkIOErrorIsTolerated disables cache if problem.
1273        LOG.error("Failed writing to bucket cache", ioex);
1274        checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
1275      }
1276    }
1277
1278    // Make sure data pages are written on media before we update maps.
1279    try {
1280      ioEngine.sync();
1281    } catch (IOException ioex) {
1282      LOG.error("Failed syncing IO engine", ioex);
1283      checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
1284      // Since we failed sync, free the blocks in bucket allocator
1285      for (int i = 0; i < entries.size(); ++i) {
1286        BucketEntry bucketEntry = bucketEntries[i];
1287        if (bucketEntry != null) {
1288          bucketAllocator.freeBlock(bucketEntry.offset(), bucketEntry.getLength());
1289          bucketEntries[i] = null;
1290        }
1291      }
1292    }
1293
1294    // Now add to backingMap if successfully added to bucket cache. Remove from ramCache if
1295    // success or error.
1296    for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1297      BlockCacheKey key = entries.get(i).getKey();
1298      // Only add if non-null entry.
1299      if (bucketEntries[i] != null) {
1300        putIntoBackingMap(key, bucketEntries[i]);
1301        if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
1302          setCacheInconsistent(true);
1303        }
1304      }
1305      // Always remove from ramCache even if we failed adding it to the block cache above.
1306      boolean existed = ramCache.remove(key, re -> {
1307        if (re != null) {
1308          heapSize.add(-1 * re.getData().heapSize());
1309        }
1310      });
1311      if (!existed && bucketEntries[i] != null) {
1312        // Block should have already been evicted. Remove it and free space.
1313        final BucketEntry bucketEntry = bucketEntries[i];
1314        bucketEntry.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
1315          if (backingMap.remove(key, bucketEntry)) {
1316            blockEvicted(key, bucketEntry, false, false);
1317          }
1318          return null;
1319        });
1320      }
1321    }
1322
1323    long used = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1324    if (used > acceptableSize()) {
1325      freeSpace("Used=" + used + " > acceptable=" + acceptableSize());
1326    }
1327    return;
1328  }
1329
1330  /**
1331   * Blocks until elements available in {@code q} then tries to grab as many as possible before
1332   * returning.
1333   * @param receptacle Where to stash the elements taken from queue. We clear before we use it just
1334   *                   in case.
1335   * @param q          The queue to take from.
1336   * @return {@code receptacle} laden with elements taken from the queue or empty if none found.
1337   */
1338  static List<RAMQueueEntry> getRAMQueueEntries(BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> q,
1339    List<RAMQueueEntry> receptacle) throws InterruptedException {
1340    // Clear sets all entries to null and sets size to 0. We retain allocations. Presume it
1341    // ok even if list grew to accommodate thousands.
1342    receptacle.clear();
1343    receptacle.add(q.take());
1344    q.drainTo(receptacle);
1345    return receptacle;
1346  }
1347
1348  /**
1349   * @see #retrieveFromFile(int[])
1350   */
1351  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "OBL_UNSATISFIED_OBLIGATION",
1352      justification = "false positive, try-with-resources ensures close is called.")
1353  void persistToFile() throws IOException {
1354    LOG.debug("Thread {} started persisting bucket cache to file",
1355      Thread.currentThread().getName());
1356    if (!isCachePersistent()) {
1357      throw new IOException("Attempt to persist non-persistent cache mappings!");
1358    }
1359    File tempPersistencePath = new File(persistencePath + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
1360    try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(tempPersistencePath, false)) {
1361      fos.write(ProtobufMagic.PB_MAGIC);
1362      BucketProtoUtils.toPB(this).writeDelimitedTo(fos);
1363    } catch (IOException e) {
1364      LOG.error("Failed to persist bucket cache to file", e);
1365      throw e;
1366    }
1367    LOG.debug("Thread {} finished persisting bucket cache to file, renaming",
1368      Thread.currentThread().getName());
1369    if (!tempPersistencePath.renameTo(new File(persistencePath))) {
1370      LOG.warn("Failed to commit cache persistent file. We might lose cached blocks if "
1371        + "RS crashes/restarts before we successfully checkpoint again.");
1372    }
1373  }
1374
1375  public boolean isCachePersistent() {
1376    return ioEngine.isPersistent() && persistencePath != null;
1377  }
1378
1379  @Override
1380  public Optional<Map<String, Long>> getRegionCachedInfo() {
1381    return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(regionCachedSize));
1382  }
1383
1384  /**
1385   * @see #persistToFile()
1386   */
1387  private void retrieveFromFile(int[] bucketSizes) throws IOException {
1388    LOG.info("Started retrieving bucket cache from file");
1389    File persistenceFile = new File(persistencePath);
1390    if (!persistenceFile.exists()) {
1391      LOG.warn("Persistence file missing! "
1392        + "It's ok if it's first run after enabling persistent cache.");
1393      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(cacheCapacity, bucketSizes, backingMap, realCacheSize);
1394      blockNumber.add(backingMap.size());
1395      backingMapValidated.set(true);
1396      return;
1397    }
1398    assert !cacheEnabled;
1399
1400    try (FileInputStream in = new FileInputStream(persistenceFile)) {
1401      int pblen = ProtobufMagic.lengthOfPBMagic();
1402      byte[] pbuf = new byte[pblen];
1403      int read = in.read(pbuf);
1404      if (read != pblen) {
1405        throw new IOException("Incorrect number of bytes read while checking for protobuf magic "
1406          + "number. Requested=" + pblen + ", Received= " + read + ", File=" + persistencePath);
1407      }
1408      if (!ProtobufMagic.isPBMagicPrefix(pbuf)) {
1409        // In 3.0 we have enough flexibility to dump the old cache data.
1410        // TODO: In 2.x line, this might need to be filled in to support reading the old format
1411        throw new IOException(
1412          "Persistence file does not start with protobuf magic number. " + persistencePath);
1413      }
1414      parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry.parseDelimitedFrom(in));
1415      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(cacheCapacity, bucketSizes, backingMap, realCacheSize);
1416      blockNumber.add(backingMap.size());
1417      LOG.info("Bucket cache retrieved from file successfully");
1418    }
1419  }
1420
1421  private void updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile() {
1422    // Update the regionCachedSize with the region size while restarting the region server
1423    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1424      LOG.debug("Updating region size map after retrieving cached file list");
1425      dumpPrefetchList();
1426    }
1427    regionCachedSize.clear();
1428    fullyCachedFiles.forEach((hFileName, hFileSize) -> {
1429      // Get the region name for each file
1430      String regionEncodedName = hFileSize.getFirst();
1431      long cachedFileSize = hFileSize.getSecond();
1432      regionCachedSize.merge(regionEncodedName, cachedFileSize,
1433        (oldpf, fileSize) -> oldpf + fileSize);
1434    });
1435  }
1436
1437  private void dumpPrefetchList() {
1438    for (Map.Entry<String, Pair<String, Long>> outerEntry : fullyCachedFiles.entrySet()) {
1439      LOG.debug("Cached File Entry:<{},<{},{}>>", outerEntry.getKey(),
1440        outerEntry.getValue().getFirst(), outerEntry.getValue().getSecond());
1441    }
1442  }
1443
1444  private void verifyCapacityAndClasses(long capacitySize, String ioclass, String mapclass)
1445    throws IOException {
1446    if (capacitySize != cacheCapacity) {
1447      throw new IOException("Mismatched cache capacity:" + StringUtils.byteDesc(capacitySize)
1448        + ", expected: " + StringUtils.byteDesc(cacheCapacity));
1449    }
1450    if (!ioEngine.getClass().getName().equals(ioclass)) {
1451      throw new IOException("Class name for IO engine mismatch: " + ioclass + ", expected:"
1452        + ioEngine.getClass().getName());
1453    }
1454    if (!backingMap.getClass().getName().equals(mapclass)) {
1455      throw new IOException("Class name for cache map mismatch: " + mapclass + ", expected:"
1456        + backingMap.getClass().getName());
1457    }
1458  }
1459
1460  private void parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry proto) throws IOException {
1461    Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair =
1462      BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(proto.getDeserializersMap(), proto.getBackingMap(),
1463        this::createRecycler);
1464    backingMap = pair.getFirst();
1465    blocksByHFile = pair.getSecond();
1466    fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1467    fullyCachedFiles.putAll(BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(proto.getCachedFilesMap()));
1468    if (proto.hasChecksum()) {
1469      try {
1470        ((PersistentIOEngine) ioEngine).verifyFileIntegrity(proto.getChecksum().toByteArray(),
1471          algorithm);
1472        backingMapValidated.set(true);
1473      } catch (IOException e) {
1474        LOG.warn("Checksum for cache file failed. "
1475          + "We need to validate each cache key in the backing map. "
1476          + "This may take some time, so we'll do it in a background thread,");
1477        Runnable cacheValidator = () -> {
1478          while (bucketAllocator == null) {
1479            try {
1480              Thread.sleep(50);
1481            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1482              throw new RuntimeException(ex);
1483            }
1484          }
1485          long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1486          int totalKeysOriginally = backingMap.size();
1487          for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> keyEntry : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1488            try {
1489              ((FileIOEngine) ioEngine).checkCacheTime(keyEntry.getValue());
1490            } catch (IOException e1) {
1491              LOG.debug("Check for key {} failed. Evicting.", keyEntry.getKey());
1492              evictBlock(keyEntry.getKey());
1493              fullyCachedFiles.remove(keyEntry.getKey().getHfileName());
1494            }
1495          }
1496          backingMapValidated.set(true);
1497          LOG.info("Finished validating {} keys in the backing map. Recovered: {}. This took {}ms.",
1498            totalKeysOriginally, backingMap.size(),
1499            (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - startTime));
1500        };
1501        Thread t = new Thread(cacheValidator);
1502        t.setDaemon(true);
1503        t.start();
1504      }
1505    } else {
1506      // if has not checksum, it means the persistence file is old format
1507      LOG.info("Persistent file is old format, it does not support verifying file integrity!");
1508      backingMapValidated.set(true);
1509    }
1510    updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile();
1511    verifyCapacityAndClasses(proto.getCacheCapacity(), proto.getIoClass(), proto.getMapClass());
1512  }
1513
1514  /**
1515   * Check whether we tolerate IO error this time. If the duration of IOEngine throwing errors
1516   * exceeds ioErrorsDurationTimeTolerated, we will disable the cache
1517   */
1518  private void checkIOErrorIsTolerated() {
1519    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1520    // Do a single read to a local variable to avoid timing issue - HBASE-24454
1521    long ioErrorStartTimeTmp = this.ioErrorStartTime;
1522    if (ioErrorStartTimeTmp > 0) {
1523      if (cacheEnabled && (now - ioErrorStartTimeTmp) > this.ioErrorsTolerationDuration) {
1524        LOG.error("IO errors duration time has exceeded " + ioErrorsTolerationDuration
1525          + "ms, disabling cache, please check your IOEngine");
1526        disableCache();
1527      }
1528    } else {
1529      this.ioErrorStartTime = now;
1530    }
1531  }
1532
1533  /**
1534   * Used to shut down the cache -or- turn it off in the case of something broken.
1535   */
1536  private void disableCache() {
1537    if (!cacheEnabled) return;
1538    LOG.info("Disabling cache");
1539    cacheEnabled = false;
1540    ioEngine.shutdown();
1541    this.scheduleThreadPool.shutdown();
1542    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i)
1543      writerThreads[i].interrupt();
1544    this.ramCache.clear();
1545    if (!ioEngine.isPersistent() || persistencePath == null) {
1546      // If persistent ioengine and a path, we will serialize out the backingMap.
1547      this.backingMap.clear();
1548      this.blocksByHFile.clear();
1549      this.fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1550      this.regionCachedSize.clear();
1551    }
1552  }
1553
1554  private void join() throws InterruptedException {
1555    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i)
1556      writerThreads[i].join();
1557  }
1558
1559  @Override
1560  public void shutdown() {
1561    disableCache();
1562    LOG.info("Shutdown bucket cache: IO persistent=" + ioEngine.isPersistent() + "; path to write="
1563      + persistencePath);
1564    if (ioEngine.isPersistent() && persistencePath != null) {
1565      try {
1566        join();
1567        if (cachePersister != null) {
1568          LOG.info("Shutting down cache persister thread.");
1569          cachePersister.shutdown();
1570          while (cachePersister.isAlive()) {
1571            Thread.sleep(10);
1572          }
1573        }
1574        persistToFile();
1575      } catch (IOException ex) {
1576        LOG.error("Unable to persist data on exit: " + ex.toString(), ex);
1577      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1578        LOG.warn("Failed to persist data on exit", e);
1579      }
1580    }
1581  }
1582
1583  /**
1584   * Needed mostly for UTs that might run in the same VM and create different BucketCache instances
1585   * on different UT methods.
1586   */
1587  @Override
1588  protected void finalize() {
1589    if (cachePersister != null && !cachePersister.isInterrupted()) {
1590      cachePersister.interrupt();
1591    }
1592  }
1593
1594  @Override
1595  public CacheStats getStats() {
1596    return cacheStats;
1597  }
1598
1599  public BucketAllocator getAllocator() {
1600    return this.bucketAllocator;
1601  }

1603  @Override
1604  public long heapSize() {
1605    return this.heapSize.sum();
1606  }
1607
1608  @Override
1609  public long size() {
1610    return this.realCacheSize.sum();
1611  }
1612
1613  @Override
1614  public long getCurrentDataSize() {
1615    return size();
1616  }
1617
1618  @Override
1619  public long getFreeSize() {
1620    return this.bucketAllocator.getFreeSize();
1621  }
1622
1623  @Override
1624  public long getBlockCount() {
1625    return this.blockNumber.sum();
1626  }
1627
1628  @Override
1629  public long getDataBlockCount() {
1630    return getBlockCount();
1631  }
1632
1633  @Override
1634  public long getCurrentSize() {
1635    return this.bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1636  }
1637
1638  protected String getAlgorithm() {
1639    return algorithm;
1640  }
1641
1642  /**
1643   * Evicts all blocks for a specific HFile.
1644   * <p>
1645   * This is used for evict-on-close to remove all blocks of a specific HFile.
1646   * @return the number of blocks evicted
1647   */
1648  @Override
1649  public int evictBlocksByHfileName(String hfileName) {
1650    return evictBlocksRangeByHfileName(hfileName, 0, Long.MAX_VALUE);
1651  }
1652
1653  @Override
1654  public int evictBlocksRangeByHfileName(String hfileName, long initOffset, long endOffset) {
1655    fileNotFullyCached(hfileName);
1656    Set<BlockCacheKey> keySet = getAllCacheKeysForFile(hfileName, initOffset, endOffset);
1657    LOG.debug("found {} blocks for file {}, starting offset: {}, end offset: {}", keySet.size(),
1658      hfileName, initOffset, endOffset);
1659    int numEvicted = 0;
1660    for (BlockCacheKey key : keySet) {
1661      if (evictBlock(key)) {
1662        ++numEvicted;
1663      }
1664    }
1665    return numEvicted;
1666  }
1667
1668  private Set<BlockCacheKey> getAllCacheKeysForFile(String hfileName, long init, long end) {
1669    return blocksByHFile.subSet(new BlockCacheKey(hfileName, init), true,
1670      new BlockCacheKey(hfileName, end), true);
1671  }
1672
1673  /**
1674   * Used to group bucket entries into priority buckets. There will be a BucketEntryGroup for each
1675   * priority (single, multi, memory). Once bucketed, the eviction algorithm takes the appropriate
1676   * number of elements out of each according to configuration parameters and their relative sizes.
1677   */
1678  private class BucketEntryGroup {
1679
1680    private CachedEntryQueue queue;
1681    private long totalSize = 0;
1682    private long bucketSize;
1683
1684    public BucketEntryGroup(long bytesToFree, long blockSize, long bucketSize) {
1685      this.bucketSize = bucketSize;
1686      queue = new CachedEntryQueue(bytesToFree, blockSize);
1687      totalSize = 0;
1688    }
1689
1690    public void add(Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> block) {
1691      totalSize += block.getValue().getLength();
1692      queue.add(block);
1693    }
1694
1695    public long free(long toFree) {
1696      Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> entry;
1697      long freedBytes = 0;
1698      // TODO avoid a cycling siutation. We find no block which is not in use and so no way to free
1699      // What to do then? Caching attempt fail? Need some changes in cacheBlock API?
1700      while ((entry = queue.pollLast()) != null) {
1701        BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey = entry.getKey();
1702        BucketEntry be = entry.getValue();
1703        if (evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(blockCacheKey, be)) {
1704          freedBytes += be.getLength();
1705        }
1706        if (freedBytes >= toFree) {
1707          return freedBytes;
1708        }
1709      }
1710      return freedBytes;
1711    }
1712
1713    public long overflow() {
1714      return totalSize - bucketSize;
1715    }
1716
1717    public long totalSize() {
1718      return totalSize;
1719    }
1720  }
1721
1722  /**
1723   * Block Entry stored in the memory with key,data and so on
1724   */
1725  static class RAMQueueEntry {
1726    private final BlockCacheKey key;
1727    private final Cacheable data;
1728    private long accessCounter;
1729    private boolean inMemory;
1730    private boolean isCachePersistent;
1731
1732    RAMQueueEntry(BlockCacheKey bck, Cacheable data, long accessCounter, boolean inMemory,
1733      boolean isCachePersistent) {
1734      this.key = bck;
1735      this.data = data;
1736      this.accessCounter = accessCounter;
1737      this.inMemory = inMemory;
1738      this.isCachePersistent = isCachePersistent;
1739    }
1740
1741    public Cacheable getData() {
1742      return data;
1743    }
1744
1745    public BlockCacheKey getKey() {
1746      return key;
1747    }
1748
1749    public void access(long accessCounter) {
1750      this.accessCounter = accessCounter;
1751    }
1752
1753    private ByteBuffAllocator getByteBuffAllocator() {
1754      if (data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1755        return ((HFileBlock) data).getByteBuffAllocator();
1756      }
1757      return ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP;
1758    }
1759
1760    public BucketEntry writeToCache(final IOEngine ioEngine, final BucketAllocator alloc,
1761      final LongAdder realCacheSize, Function<BucketEntry, Recycler> createRecycler,
1762      ByteBuffer metaBuff) throws IOException {
1763      int len = data.getSerializedLength();
1764      // This cacheable thing can't be serialized
1765      if (len == 0) {
1766        return null;
1767      }
1768      if (isCachePersistent && data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1769        len += Long.BYTES; // we need to record the cache time for consistency check in case of
1770                           // recovery
1771      }
1772      long offset = alloc.allocateBlock(len);
1773      boolean succ = false;
1774      BucketEntry bucketEntry = null;
1775      try {
1776        int diskSizeWithHeader = (data instanceof HFileBlock)
1777          ? ((HFileBlock) data).getOnDiskSizeWithHeader()
1778          : data.getSerializedLength();
1779        bucketEntry = new BucketEntry(offset, len, diskSizeWithHeader, accessCounter, inMemory,
1780          createRecycler, getByteBuffAllocator());
1781        bucketEntry.setDeserializerReference(data.getDeserializer());
1782        if (data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1783          // If an instance of HFileBlock, save on some allocations.
1784          HFileBlock block = (HFileBlock) data;
1785          ByteBuff sliceBuf = block.getBufferReadOnly();
1786          block.getMetaData(metaBuff);
1787          // adds the cache time prior to the block and metadata part
1788          if (isCachePersistent) {
1789            ByteBuffer buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(Long.BYTES);
1790            buffer.putLong(bucketEntry.getCachedTime());
1791            buffer.rewind();
1792            ioEngine.write(buffer, offset);
1793            ioEngine.write(sliceBuf, (offset + Long.BYTES));
1794          } else {
1795            ioEngine.write(sliceBuf, offset);
1796          }
1797          ioEngine.write(metaBuff, offset + len - metaBuff.limit());
1798        } else {
1799          // Only used for testing.
1800          ByteBuffer bb = ByteBuffer.allocate(len);
1801          data.serialize(bb, true);
1802          ioEngine.write(bb, offset);
1803        }
1804        succ = true;
1805      } finally {
1806        if (!succ) {
1807          alloc.freeBlock(offset, len);
1808        }
1809      }
1810      realCacheSize.add(len);
1811      return bucketEntry;
1812    }
1813  }
1814
1815  /**
1816   * Only used in test
1817   */
1818  void stopWriterThreads() throws InterruptedException {
1819    for (WriterThread writerThread : writerThreads) {
1820      writerThread.disableWriter();
1821      writerThread.interrupt();
1822      writerThread.join();
1823    }
1824  }
1825
1826  @Override
1827  public Iterator<CachedBlock> iterator() {
1828    // Don't bother with ramcache since stuff is in here only a little while.
1829    final Iterator<Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>> i = this.backingMap.entrySet().iterator();
1830    return new Iterator<CachedBlock>() {
1831      private final long now = System.nanoTime();
1832
1833      @Override
1834      public boolean hasNext() {
1835        return i.hasNext();
1836      }
1837
1838      @Override
1839      public CachedBlock next() {
1840        final Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> e = i.next();
1841        return new CachedBlock() {
1842          @Override
1843          public String toString() {
1844            return BlockCacheUtil.toString(this, now);
1845          }
1846
1847          @Override
1848          public BlockPriority getBlockPriority() {
1849            return e.getValue().getPriority();
1850          }
1851
1852          @Override
1853          public BlockType getBlockType() {
1854            // Not held by BucketEntry. Could add it if wanted on BucketEntry creation.
1855            return null;
1856          }
1857
1858          @Override
1859          public long getOffset() {
1860            return e.getKey().getOffset();
1861          }
1862
1863          @Override
1864          public long getSize() {
1865            return e.getValue().getLength();
1866          }
1867
1868          @Override
1869          public long getCachedTime() {
1870            return e.getValue().getCachedTime();
1871          }
1872
1873          @Override
1874          public String getFilename() {
1875            return e.getKey().getHfileName();
1876          }
1877
1878          @Override
1879          public int compareTo(CachedBlock other) {
1880            int diff = this.getFilename().compareTo(other.getFilename());
1881            if (diff != 0) return diff;
1882
1883            diff = Long.compare(this.getOffset(), other.getOffset());
1884            if (diff != 0) return diff;
1885            if (other.getCachedTime() < 0 || this.getCachedTime() < 0) {
1886              throw new IllegalStateException(
1887                "" + this.getCachedTime() + ", " + other.getCachedTime());
1888            }
1889            return Long.compare(other.getCachedTime(), this.getCachedTime());
1890          }
1891
1892          @Override
1893          public int hashCode() {
1894            return e.getKey().hashCode();
1895          }
1896
1897          @Override
1898          public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1899            if (obj instanceof CachedBlock) {
1900              CachedBlock cb = (CachedBlock) obj;
1901              return compareTo(cb) == 0;
1902            } else {
1903              return false;
1904            }
1905          }
1906        };
1907      }
1908
1909      @Override
1910      public void remove() {
1911        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1912      }
1913    };
1914  }
1915
1916  @Override
1917  public BlockCache[] getBlockCaches() {
1918    return null;
1919  }
1920
1921  public int getRpcRefCount(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
1922    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
1923    if (bucketEntry != null) {
1924      return bucketEntry.refCnt() - (bucketEntry.markedAsEvicted.get() ? 0 : 1);
1925    }
1926    return 0;
1927  }
