1956
1957  /**
1958   * Wrapped the delegate ConcurrentMap with maintaining its block's reference count.
1959   */
1960  static class RAMCache {
1961    /**
1962     * Defined the map as {@link ConcurrentHashMap} explicitly here, because in
1963     * {@link RAMCache#get(BlockCacheKey)} and
1964     * {@link RAMCache#putIfAbsent(BlockCacheKey, BucketCache.RAMQueueEntry)} , we need to guarantee
1965     * the atomicity of map#computeIfPresent(key, func) and map#putIfAbsent(key, func). Besides, the
1966     * func method can execute exactly once only when the key is present(or absent) and under the
1967     * lock context. Otherwise, the reference count of block will be messed up. Notice that the
1968     * {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap} can not guarantee that.
1969     */
1970    final ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, RAMQueueEntry> delegate = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
1971
1972    public boolean containsKey(BlockCacheKey key) {
1973      return delegate.containsKey(key);
1974    }
1975
1976    public RAMQueueEntry get(BlockCacheKey key) {
1977      return delegate.computeIfPresent(key, (k, re) -> {
1978        // It'll be referenced by RPC, so retain atomically here. if the get and retain is not
1979        // atomic, another thread may remove and release the block, when retaining in this thread we
1980        // may retain a block with refCnt=0 which is disallowed. (see HBASE-22422)
1981        re.getData().retain();
1982        return re;
1983      });
1984    }
1985
1986    /**
1987     * Return the previous associated value, or null if absent. It has the same meaning as
1988     * {@link ConcurrentMap#putIfAbsent(Object, Object)}
1989     */
1990    public RAMQueueEntry putIfAbsent(BlockCacheKey key, RAMQueueEntry entry) {
1991      AtomicBoolean absent = new AtomicBoolean(false);
1992      RAMQueueEntry re = delegate.computeIfAbsent(key, k -> {
1993        // The RAMCache reference to this entry, so reference count should be increment.
1994        entry.getData().retain();
1995        absent.set(true);
1996        return entry;
1997      });
1998      return absent.get() ? null : re;
1999    }
2000
2001    public boolean remove(BlockCacheKey key) {
2002      return remove(key, re -> {
2003      });
2004    }
2005
2006    /**
2007     * Defined an {@link Consumer} here, because once the removed entry release its reference count,
2008     * then it's ByteBuffers may be recycled and accessing it outside this method will be thrown an
2009     * exception. the consumer will access entry to remove before release its reference count.
2010     * Notice, don't change its reference count in the {@link Consumer}
2011     */
2012    public boolean remove(BlockCacheKey key, Consumer<RAMQueueEntry> action) {
2013      RAMQueueEntry previous = delegate.remove(key);
2014      action.accept(previous);
2015      if (previous != null) {
2016        previous.getData().release();
2017      }
2018      return previous != null;
2019    }
2020
2021    public boolean isEmpty() {
2022      return delegate.isEmpty();
2023    }
2024
2025    public void clear() {
2026      Iterator<Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, RAMQueueEntry>> it = delegate.entrySet().iterator();
2027      while (it.hasNext()) {
2028        RAMQueueEntry re = it.next().getValue();
2029        it.remove();
2030        re.getData().release();
2031      }
2032    }
2033
2034    public boolean hasBlocksForFile(String fileName) {
2035      return delegate.keySet().stream().filter(key -> key.getHfileName().equals(fileName))
2036        .findFirst().isPresent();
2037    }
2038  }
2039
2040  public Map<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> getBackingMap() {
2041    return backingMap;
2042  }
2043
2044  public AtomicBoolean getBackingMapValidated() {
2045    return backingMapValidated;
2046  }

2048  @Override
2049  public Optional<Map<String, Pair<String, Long>>> getFullyCachedFiles() {
2050    return Optional.of(fullyCachedFiles);
2051  }
2052
2053  public static Optional<BucketCache> getBucketCacheFromCacheConfig(CacheConfig cacheConf) {
2054    if (cacheConf.getBlockCache().isPresent()) {
2055      BlockCache bc = cacheConf.getBlockCache().get();
2056      if (bc instanceof CombinedBlockCache) {
2057        BlockCache l2 = ((CombinedBlockCache) bc).getSecondLevelCache();
2058        if (l2 instanceof BucketCache) {
2059          return Optional.of((BucketCache) l2);
2060        }
2061      } else if (bc instanceof BucketCache) {
2062        return Optional.of((BucketCache) bc);
2063      }
2064    }
2065    return Optional.empty();
2066  }
2067
2068  @Override
2069  public void notifyFileCachingCompleted(Path fileName, int totalBlockCount, int dataBlockCount,
2070    long size) {
2071    // block eviction may be happening in the background as prefetch runs,
2072    // so we need to count all blocks for this file in the backing map under
2073    // a read lock for the block offset
2074    final List<ReentrantReadWriteLock> locks = new ArrayList<>();
2075    LOG.debug("Notifying caching completed for file {}, with total blocks {}, and data blocks {}",
2076      fileName, totalBlockCount, dataBlockCount);
2077    try {
2078      final MutableInt count = new MutableInt();
2079      LOG.debug("iterating over {} entries in the backing map", backingMap.size());
2080      Set<BlockCacheKey> result = getAllCacheKeysForFile(fileName.getName(), 0, Long.MAX_VALUE);
2081      if (result.isEmpty() && StoreFileInfo.isReference(fileName)) {
2082        result = getAllCacheKeysForFile(
2083          StoreFileInfo.getReferredToRegionAndFile(fileName.getName()).getSecond(), 0,
2084          Long.MAX_VALUE);
2085      }
2086      result.stream().forEach(entry -> {
2087        LOG.debug("found block for file {} in the backing map. Acquiring read lock for offset {}",
2088          fileName.getName(), entry.getOffset());
2089        ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = offsetLock.getLock(entry.getOffset());
2090        lock.readLock().lock();
2091        locks.add(lock);
2092        if (backingMap.containsKey(entry) && entry.getBlockType() == BlockType.DATA) {
2093          count.increment();
2094        }
2095      });
2096      int metaCount = totalBlockCount - dataBlockCount;
2097      // BucketCache would only have data blocks
2098      if (dataBlockCount == count.getValue()) {
2099        LOG.debug("File {} has now been fully cached.", fileName);
2100        fileCacheCompleted(fileName, size);
2101      } else {
2102        LOG.debug(
2103          "Prefetch executor completed for {}, but only {} data blocks were cached. "
2104            + "Total data blocks for file: {}. "
2105            + "Checking for blocks pending cache in cache writer queue.",
2106          fileName, count.getValue(), dataBlockCount);
2107        if (ramCache.hasBlocksForFile(fileName.getName())) {
2108          for (ReentrantReadWriteLock lock : locks) {
2109            lock.readLock().unlock();
2110          }
2111          LOG.debug("There are still blocks pending caching for file {}. Will sleep 100ms "
2112            + "and try the verification again.", fileName);
2113          Thread.sleep(100);
2114          notifyFileCachingCompleted(fileName, totalBlockCount, dataBlockCount, size);
2115        } else if (
2116          (getAllCacheKeysForFile(fileName.getName(), 0, Long.MAX_VALUE).size() - metaCount)
2117              == dataBlockCount
2118        ) {
2119          LOG.debug("We counted {} data blocks, expected was {}, there was no more pending in "
2120            + "the cache write queue but we now found that total cached blocks for file {} "
2121            + "is equal to data block count.", count, dataBlockCount, fileName.getName());
2122          fileCacheCompleted(fileName, size);
2123        } else {
2124          LOG.info("We found only {} data blocks cached from a total of {} for file {}, "
2125            + "but no blocks pending caching. Maybe cache is full or evictions "
2126            + "happened concurrently to cache prefetch.", count, dataBlockCount, fileName);
2127        }
2128      }
2129    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
2130      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2131    } finally {
2132      for (ReentrantReadWriteLock lock : locks) {
2133        lock.readLock().unlock();
2134      }
2135    }
2136  }
2137
2138  @Override
2139  public Optional<Boolean> blockFitsIntoTheCache(HFileBlock block) {
2140    long currentUsed = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
2141    boolean result = (currentUsed + block.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader()) < acceptableSize();
2142    return Optional.of(result);
2143  }
2144
2145  @Override
2146  public Optional<Boolean> shouldCacheFile(String fileName) {
2147    // if we don't have the file in fullyCachedFiles, we should cache it
2148    return Optional.of(!fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(fileName));
2149  }
2150
2151  @Override
2152  public Optional<Boolean> isAlreadyCached(BlockCacheKey key) {
2153    boolean foundKey = backingMap.containsKey(key);
2154    // if there's no entry for the key itself, we need to check if this key is for a reference,
2155    // and if so, look for a block from the referenced file using this getBlockForReference method.
2156    return Optional.of(foundKey ? true : getBlockForReference(key) != null);
2157  }
2158
2159  @Override
2160  public Optional<Integer> getBlockSize(BlockCacheKey key) {
2161    BucketEntry entry = backingMap.get(key);
2162    if (entry == null) {
2163      // the key might be for a reference tha we had found the block from the referenced file in
2164      // the cache when we first tried to cache it.
2165      entry = getBlockForReference(key);
2166      return entry == null ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of(entry.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader());
2167    } else {
2168      return Optional.of(entry.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader());
2169    }
2170
2171  }
2172}
